Lan is 58 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents; her children are grown up.

She has a retail business selling coal. She is requesting a loan to purchase coal to resell. Lan has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 3.19.615.02.Quán Lào solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase coal to resell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 49 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. For 20 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of products such as sugar, soap, eggs, spices, and other groceries. Amelita works very hard to provide for her family.

Amelita is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 32 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. To raise her family, Anabel is engaged in a hog-raising business, which she has been doing for three years, while her husband manage their motorcycle transportation business. They both work hard to uplift their children out of poverty.

Anabel is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional hogs and feed. She hopes to expand her business as well as their family status.

loans.use: to purchase hogs and feed

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is an experienced farmer from Sarigyugh village of Shirak region. Her family consists of her husband, three sons (her youngest son is a school-age boy), her daughter, and her elderly pensioner mother-in-law. Marine works in the local kindergarten as a cook assistant, and her middle son has migrated to Russia as a labor migrant. He works there and sends money to the family to take care of their needs. Marine's husband in a contractual serviceman in the military service. All the family work hard to earn a living. 

Marine is engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding sheep and pigs, and in cultivation of corn, potatoes, grass, cherries, plums, apples, pears, and walnuts. Her husband and eldest son sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Marine needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase three heifers. Marine and her large family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is an experienced farmer from Chiva village of Vayots Dzor region. He lives with his wife, son, and 6-year-old daughter. 

To take care of his family, Artak is engaged in cattle breeding and in plant cultivation in a greenhouse. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Artak's wife and son assist him greatly in his daily activities related to farming. 

As life is getting more expensive with time, Artak needs to expand his agribusiness in order to be able to meet his family's needs. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a huge support to this hardworking man and his family and will enable him to renovate the greenhouse and to purchase a calf. Artak and his family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the greenhouse and to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is from Hovtun village of Shirak region. He lives with his wife, two school-age daughters and a 1-year-old son. Ararat is the head of the village local self-governance body. His wife works as a computer operator at the village local self-governance body. Both of them work hard to be able to meet the needs of the family. 

They are also engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding sheep, pigs and piglets, and in cultivation of wheat and grass. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

To be able to organize his agribusiness in a more efficient and productive way Ararat needs a loan of USD 2,700 to purchase agricultural machinery, which will make their farming activities more effective. The family relies on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for the support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en:
Sirvand is an experienced agronomist from Geghanist village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband and son. She is employed in the private sector.

Sirvard and her family own a piece of land on which they have built a glass greenhouse, where they grow roses and sell the flowers in the local market. This is a very important source of the family's income. 

To be able to run their agribusiness during the cold season, Sirvard and her family want to have a heating system in the greenhouse. To reach that goal, Sirvard needs a loan of USD 2,500 to obtain a heating system for the greenhouse. She and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to obtain a heating system for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Shaga

texts.en:
Shaga is an agronomist with 10 years of experience working in that field. He lives with his retired parents, his wife, and two children. He used to work in a local village municipality. However, the main income for their family now comes from farming. Shaga keeps chickens, pigs and cows. Near the village where Shaga and his family live, they own a plot of land where they cultivate grass for feeding the livestock. Shaga is able to sell meat and dairy products to re-sellers and thereby provide basic living conditions for his family.

Now, Shaga will use this loan of 2,500 USD to purchase three calves and barley seeds for cultivation. The loan will improve Shaga's farming business and will also increase the income gathered from that activity.

loans.use: to buy three calves and barley seeds

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a young agronomist from Hayanist village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband and her father-in-law. Anna works at the village local self-governance body. With the help of her family members she is also engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding sheep, pigs and piglets, and in cultivation of greens, grass, and apricots. Her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of family's income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way Anna needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase pigs and some forage for the livestock. It will help her maintain and develop her agribusiness. Anna and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Dios Bendice Pacaya Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman seis mujeres emprendedoras luchadoras una de ellas es Candelaria tiene la edad de 30 años, casada, su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 20 años. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de naranja, limón, yuca, chilote, quequisque, pipián.  La otra integrante es Nubia de 38 años su negocio es la venta de zapatos, María Elena de 53 años su negocio es una pulpería, Blanca se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa usada, Esther tiene 43 años su negocio es la venta de banano, y Yarixa  tiene 24 años su negocio es la crianza y venta de pollo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of six determined entrepreneurial women. One of them is Candelaria who is 30 years old and is married. For 20 years she has had a business selling fruit and vegetables. She needs the loan to buy oranges, lemons, yucca, shallots, taro root and "pipián" [a type of squash]

The other members are:
Nubia (38) who sells shoes, María Elena (53) who runs a small grocery store, Blanca who has a business selling used clothing, Esther (43) who sells bananas and 24 year old Yarixa who rears and sells chickens.

loans.use: to buy oranges, lemons, yucca, shallots, taro root and "pipián" [a type of squash]

loans.name: 13.02.01 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh, a 54-year-old married mother of two, lives with her family in Thanh Hoa city, a town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been operating a food stall selling vegetables for more than 10 years, and is the group leader of the 13.02.01 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Oanh is now requesting her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase vegetables to resell. In the future, she hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: 13.02.02 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Hải is 36 years old and she is married with two children. Hải lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has a manufacturing business sewing curtains. Hải has been involved in this business for more than ten years.  The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase material and a sewing machine to sew blankets and pillows to sell.

This is Hải's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 13.02.02 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

With her business profit, Hải hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase material and a sewing machine to sew blankets and pillows to sell.

loans.name: 3.05.613.05.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 41 years old and she is married with one child who is grown. Hoa is the group leader of the 3.05.613.05.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents since her child is grown. Hoa works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2003, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in future.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: 3.14.605.05.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Lâm is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Lâm lives with two dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Lâm is the group leader of the 3.14.605.05 Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Lâm has a retail business selling clothing. Lâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lâm faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

In 2010, Lâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lâm has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lâm hopes to make enough money to provide for her children and for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: 13.02.03 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Huyền is 18 years old and is married with no children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past three years, Huyền has operated a food stall where she sells fruit. She is the group leader of the 13.02.03 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of three members. This will be Huyền’s first loan. Her major business hardship is her lack of capital.

Huyền is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. She hopes that her loan will help her business to do well and she hopes that her family will be happy and healthy and able to travel within the country for vacation.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: 3.05.611.14.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Thu is 42 years old and married with two children, one of whom is grown up. She lives  and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Thu is a farmer who has raised poultry and cattle for more than 10 years. She is the group leader of the 3.05.611.14.Thiệu Trung solidarity group which consists of four members. Thu has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Her main business hardship is her lack of capital.

Thu is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use the profit from her loan to make enough money to provide for her kids, maintain a successful business, and buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Retail store is the primary source of income of Marife. She has been in this business for almost two years. She is now 38 years old and happily married with three children. 

As of now, Marife wants to re-stock her sari-sari store. With this concern, she's asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles, biscuits, and condiments to sell.She's hoping that her business will continue to grow to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, beverages, noodles, biscuits, and condiments to sell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a rice farmer from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children. Her husband works as a painter. 

Janeth works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and profit. 

In the future, Janeth hopes to expand her farm so that it will augment her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Jamela

texts.en:
Jamela is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the products needed in her ready-to-wear business and her cellphone accessories retailing business. Her business has been running for two years now and it keeps on growing. Her income from business is helpful in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their family.
 
She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan for her to buy merchandise such as clothing, cellphone accessories, and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jamela dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise such as clothing, cellphone accessories, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Divina works hard to support her family.

She has a selling home products business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from upholstery.  

Divina is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to purchase appliances to sell to customers.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase appliances to sell to customers.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 40 years old and married with two children. For the past two years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from selling food. Liza has borrowed and repaid one previous loan from NWTF. She works hard to provide for her family.

Liza is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Luzviminda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 27 years of age, married and blessed with two children. She operates a junk shop business in her village. She has been in this business for almost four years; through her income, she was able to purchase two motorcycles which she uses for daily routes in buying used bottles and metal scrap in different villages.
 
She dreams for continued growth of her business to gain a higher income and be able to sustain her children's needs in attaining a higher level of education. Hence, she is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy used bottles, plastics and scrap metals in different villages. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy used bottles, plastics and scrap metals in different villages.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry manages a variety store, selling vegetables and grocery items in his village. He patiently operates his business to supplement the income of his spouse, who works abroad. He wants to increase his merchandise; that's why he is now asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase soft drinks, vinegar, sugar, biscuits and eggs to sell. According to him, he will pay his loan in full and keep extending good products and services to all his customers.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, vinegar, sugar, biscuits and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 37 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She is running a retail store to gain income and supplement her spouse income in farming. 

She has insufficient funds now, so that's why she is asking a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchased canned goods, eggs, biscuits, and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to keep selling good and affordable products to all her customers to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, biscuits, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta su historia:

Silvia tiene 45 años, vive en unión libre desde hace 28 años y ya no tiene dependientes económicos, ya que sus hijos ya no viven con ella. Siempre le ha gustado vender y con su negocio de abarrotes ya tiene 8 años.

A ella le gusta mucho como ha crecido su negocio, inició con algo muy pequeño donde no tenía refrigeradores y muy pocos productos, ahora ya tiene vitrina, refrigerador, rebanadora y variedad de productos. Silvia pide este préstamo para remodelar y hacer mejores necesarias en su casa.

Gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo Silvia ha logrado hacer algunas mejoras a su casa como poner losa, cuando antes tenía lámina, y amueblarla. Su principal reto es continuar con la remodelación de su hogar.
texts.en:
Silvia is a micro-entrepreneur and client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:
Silvia is 45 years old and has lived with her partner since she was 28. She doesn't have any economic dependents as her children no longer live with her. She has always liked to sell things and she has had her grocery business for 8 years.
She very much likes the way that her business has grown. She began with something very small that didn't have refrigerators and had very few products. Today, she has a counter, refrigerator, slicer, and a variety of products. Silvia is requesting this loan to remodel and make necessary improvements to her house. 
Thanks to her hard work, Silvia has been able to make some improvements to her house such as putting in solid floors where before there was just plywood, and to furnish it. Her main goal is to continue remodeling her home.

loans.use: to make necessary repairs to her home.

loans.name: Marylen

texts.en:
This is Marylen. She runs a general store and previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Marylen’s earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and for her family’s personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Marylen is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at her store the better as more items will result in better profit. Marylen’s business profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and provide for her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Marylen dreams to be successful in her business and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 43 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. For the past two years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Maribel has borrowed three previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Maribel is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Leonora earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks like snack foods, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, shampoo, etc. to sell for her general store business. In the picture we see Leonora with one of her children.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like snack foods, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Delia works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling fish. Delia has been sustaining her businesses with her previous six loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva.

Delia is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients to make food to sell. In the future, she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is asking for a loan because she believes that, through it, she will improve her business.

The previous loan enabled her to save money from her food stall business. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase maize flour, wheat flour,  rice, and meat for her business.

Mwaka feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan which, to date, has allowed her to maintain her level of profits, to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 52 years old and married with nine children. With two children currently in school, Lucena works very hard to provide for them.

Lucena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like soft drinks, eggs, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Lucena has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, eggs, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc. 

Lucena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, eggs, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 45-year-old lady. She is a very poor and needy woman. Her son provides sheltering services to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and uses wooden planks and bamboo. He is currently running low on supplies. 

Her son is unable to continue his business without wooden boards, planks, and bamboo. Therefore, Rani requested a loan for her son so that he can buy new smooth wooden boards, planks, and bamboo to continue his services again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and that her son will generate maximum profit with the help of this loan. 

Rani is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan because they help her son to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: To buy sheltering material for providing sheltering services.

loans.name: Ulan

texts.en:
Ulan is a freshman in the International and Business Law Program. This is his story:

 “I chose the Department of International and Business Law for several reasons. I have always wanted to link my future life to jurisprudence and to become a judge. Given the shortcomings of the legal system in the Kyrgyz Republic, I believe that there is a need for professional, young, creative and honest lawyers in order to function in an increasingly complex and globalized world. Certainly it is not easy to be a professional and successful lawyer. You must have the necessary qualities such as perseverance, leadership, an analytical mind, and a willingness to study hard. During high school I tried to develop these qualities, and I learned teamwork, dedication, perseverance, honesty, and hard work. I learned English, because it is the language of international communication. I was an active member of the debate club, where we learned to argue and clearly express our opinions. I consider it my civic duty to contribute to the development of the legal system in the Kyrgyz Republic, and to the facilitation of entrepreneurship and economic growth in general. I also want to provide for my family, and make sure that they are able to live a good life.”

Ulan is requesting a loan to pay for his higher education.

loans.use: to pay for higher education

loans.name: Vladislav

texts.en:
Vladislav is a freshman in the Liberal Arts and Sciences Program. This is his story:

"I chose liberal arts because I do not know what I want to be when I graduate. In most universities, students have to choose their future profession when they finish high school. AUCA is the only university in the country where you can try different subjects and decide later what your future profession will be. I think that I like business, but I also want to try some courses in political science and in psychology.

"In high school I did not work as hard as I should have, and I think that I missed some opportunities to learn interesting things. Now that I have the chance to study at AUCA, I am going to be a much more serious student, and also participate in all of the student life activities at the university. I especially want to take part in all of the football tournaments, and also some volunteering activities to help motivate other young students to study and work hard."

loans.use: to pay for higher education

loans.name: Qhantati Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “QHANTATI” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía, bordado de manteles, tienda de carnicería, ropa de bebe, atención de cabinas telefónicas, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paulina es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo adquirió, ya estructurado, pues una prima que tuvo que viajar a otro país le traspaso.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las comunidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se encuentra una acompañante ella esta con un sonbrero negro.
texts.en:
The “QHANTATI” credit group will start its eighth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Los Andes center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Paulina is the president. The businesses that the members have in the group are varied. Among them are: artisanal crafts, embroidering, a butcher shop, baby clothing, a telephone booth service, and weaving blankets. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the small businesswomen, including Paulina. She says that she has been in Pro Mujer for five years. She joined at the invitation of a counselor of the institution who went to visit her in her house. Right now, she has a business selling meat. She says that she acquired this business, already running, because a cousin who travelled to another country transferred it to her.
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying meat wholesale. She will acquire it from the communities in the La Paz department and later she will sell it in her locale. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has two children.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the areas of credit, health and training that the institution offers. 

In the image there is a woman accompanying them. She is wearing a black hat.

loans.use: to buy meat wholesale.

loans.name: Chyngyz

texts.en:
Chyngyz is a freshman in the Liberal Arts and Sciences Program. This is his story:

I want to attend AUCA for many reasons. I know many people who have gone to AUCA and all of them have said that it is a great place to study and that the students are always successful in getting a job when they finish. 

Every person has its own talent. At AUCA I hope to develop my talent in several directions. Right now, I am most interested in software engineering and mathematics. In high school, I was able to work with computers to develop some programs and websites and I really like the technical challenge. I hope to learn how to do network administration and also to program in other computer languages. AUCA has a strong program in this and many of the alumni work for big technology companies, like Microsoft and Cisco.

I hope that, in the future, I will be able to work for such a company and be able to help my parents, who have already made a huge investment in my education.

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Eriberto Alonso

texts.es:
Eriberto, no tiene ningún grado de estudio ya que sus padres eran de la idea que el estudio no servia para nada y lo único que ayuda es el trabajo. Él esta casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa, sus  hijos ya todos están acompañados.


Actualmente se dedica a comprar y vender maíz y frijoles hace esto desde hace unos 15 años y lo aprendió por que él trabajaba antes en la agricultura; pero no obtenía mayores ganancias y eso lo llevo a empezar este negocio. Él no tiene horario de trabajo sale desde las 5 de mañana se traslada a todos los cantones de la ciudad, pues anda comprando el maíz y frijoles por quintales y los lleva a vender a las comerciales de la ciudad, recorre cerca de unos 50 kilómetros diarias en un camioncito y lo ayuda su hijo que es el único apoyo que él tiene.


El préstamo será invertido, para comprar mayor cantidad de granos, pues hay momentos en los cuales no le alcanza el efectivo que tiene para comprar mas, él sabe que si compra mayor cantidad asi vera incrementado sus entradas económicas

Sus sueños, son tener una mejor vivienda de la que ahora tiene y poder tener otro vehículo para dárselo a su hijo, ya que él quiere dejarle algo para cuando él no este, ademas sueña con tener una tienda fuerte de granos básicos y poder estar en un lugar fijo, esta seguro que con la ayuda del crédito podrá hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Eriberto did not attend school because his parents didn’t believe that education was beneficial and the only thing that mattered was work.  He is married and his wife works in the home.  His children are already married.

He buys and sells corn and beans and has been doing this for 15 years. He learned this because he used to work in farming but he didn’t make much money and this drove him to start this business.  He doesn’t have a fixed schedule, but goes out at 5:00 am and goes through all the neighborhoods in town, buying corn and beans by the quintal and taking them to sell to the stores in town.  He travels about 50 km per day in a little truck and his son helps him; this is all the help he has.

He will use the money from this loan to buy grain in quantity because there are times when he doesn’t have enough cash to buy more.  He knows that he will see an increase in his financial gains if he buys more.

His dreams are to have a larger home than the one he has now and be able to have another vehicle to give to his son because he wants to leave him something for when he is no longer there.  He also wants to have a grain store in a fixed location.  He is certain that he will be able to make his dreams a reality with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Carmen de 31 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudo terminar sus estudios, por la falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus clientes.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, queso, crema, detergente, jugos, gaseosas, tiste. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
31 year old Carmen is married and has two children. She is originally from Sauce, a place in the north of the country. She can be characterized as hardworking, responsible, and full of desire to get ahead. In her free time, she likes to enjoy the company of her children. Unfortunately, she was note able to finish school because of a lack of financial resources. Today, she strives day to day to offer her children a better future. 
Thanks to her efforts and her desire to succeed, she has a grocery store, which is a little store where she sells food in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, cream, detergents, juices, sodas. She works in her store 12 hours a day, selling her products, and it is in her home. The goal of this loan is to have business capital and to supply her store where she buys and sells groceries so that, in the near future, she can make better profits. Carmen is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people who have scarce resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: for business capital and to supply her grocery store where she buys and sells food such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, cream, detergent, juices, soda.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer - Accha Baja Group

texts.es:
La socia Livia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVO AMANECER -ACCHA BAJA, él banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Acca Baja, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Irene tiene 41 años es soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajado con su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de comida, y crianza de animales menores.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con todas sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Livia is a member of the NUEVO AMANECER -ACCHA BAJA communal bank, located in the Acca Baja community, within the Calca province and Cusco department.

Irene is 41 years old, single, and has a son.  She has a grocery store where she sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, and other things.  She has been doing this for some time and it’s going well for her because of her dedication each day.  She wants to continue working in her business so she can continue supporting her family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, and other things.

The other members sell food and raise small animals.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: José María

texts.es: Don José es originario de Chinandega casado y padre de un hijo. De 54 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de fertilizantes. José María inicio su negocio con la liquidación que obtuvo en una finca en la que laboro por muchos años llamada La Jáquima. Hoy en día José María cuenta con un negocio establecido de fertilizantes. Solicita el crédito para la compra de granos, fertilizantes y artículos para la agricultura. Su plan futuro es solidificar bien su negocio y así brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is originally from Chinandega. He is married and the father of one son. He is 54 years old. He is a businessman and works selling fertilizers. José María began his business with the settlement he received from a farm where he worked for many years called La Jáquima. Today, José María runs an established fertilizer business. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and agricultural supplies. His future plan is to strengthen his business and so to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and farm supplies.

loans.name: Dios Nos Guia Group

texts.es:
El grupo dios nos guia esta formado por cuatro integrante cada uno cuenta con sus negocio karen es propietaria de un salon de belleza, maria es propietaria de un puesto de verduras, byron vende ropa nueva,y el señor lester
vende ropa usada y nueva todos ello son luchadores, la señora eloiza vende de lunes a domingo en su puesto de verdura desde la 6 de la mañana hasta la siete de la noche con mucho esfuerso ella a sacado andar su negocio y a crecido poco a poco.
solicita un financiamiento para invertirle un poco mas a su negocio, ya que sus sueños son de tener mas grande sus negocios y poder sacar adelante a sus familias
texts.en: The Dios Nos Guia group is made up of four members. Each has a business. Karen is the owner of a beauty salon, Maria is the owner of a vegetable stall, Byron sells new clothes, and Lester sells used and new clothing. All of them are fighters. Maria Eloiza works at her vegetable stall from Monday to Sunday from 6 in the morning until seven at night. She has been able to get her business ahead  and grow little by little with a lot of hard work. She is asking for a loan to invest a little more in her business. Their dreams are to make their business bigger and be able to get their families ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the business such as vegetables, clothing and materials for the salon.

loans.name: Luz Del Sol Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman cuatro socias una de ellas es Heylen de 25 años de edad, soltera, su negocio es la venta de variedades como zapatos, prendas y ropa desde hace 5 años, su hermana y ella atienden el negocio. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 4 años. El credito lo requiere para la compra de inventario de ropa nueva de todo estilo y marca como es pantalones, camisas, blusas, shores, trajes, camisolas, vestidos, etc. Meyling tiene 33 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y usada, Brenda mujer de 37 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, ropa de niño, ropa interior y sandalias. Melania tiene 54 años su negocio es la venta de variedades.
texts.en:
This groups is made up of four members. One of them is Heylen who is 25 years old and single. Her business has been selling shoes, garments and clothing for the past five years. She and her sister take care of the business. She has been a member of the ADIM for four years. Heylen needs a loan to buy new clothing of all styles and brands like pants,. shirts, blouses, shorts, suits, sport shirts, dresses etc.

Meyling is 33 and her business is selling new and used clothing. Brenda is 37 and she sells cosmetics, children's clothing, underwear and sandals. Melania is 54 and she sells clothing, etc.

loans.use: to buy new clothing of all styles and brands, like pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, suits, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Benkadi est composé de femmes mariées et d’une veuve qui ont en moyenne 34 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djekonobougou, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de la volaille, de condiments, du savon, des beignets, de céréales et d’autres articles divers.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises citées ci-dessus.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente SITAN  la personne  assise au milieu compte acheter, 15 poules,  trois sacs  de son de mil, quatre sacs de patate dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes  à Wacoro et environnants. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20000 FCFA qui sera en partie utilisé dans l’achat des médicaments et si possible dans celui d’un mouton.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women and one widow who are on average 34 years old with three children. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Djekonobougou, in the commune of Wacoro, Dioila prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali).
They met through family, neighbourhood ties and friendships. They sell poultry, condiments, soap, fritters, cereals and various other articles.
The women of the Benkadi group are on their second solidarity loan. They will use it for purchasing the various products mentioned above.
Sitan, who is sitting in the middle, plans to buy 15 hens, three bags of millet bran, and four bags of potatoes in the neighbouring villages. She sells her goods in Wacoro and locally. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20000 FCFA that she will use to buy medication and if possible also a sheep.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Agusto Cesar

texts.es:
Agusto de  34 años de edad, soltero con un hijo menor de edad, es originario del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde  temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo. Y brindarles las oportunidades que el no tuvo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cerdos  en pie. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias en su actividad. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cerdos en pie, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Agusto agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Agusto is 34 years old. He is single and has one minor son. He is from El Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the country. He is described as being hardworking, responsible and eager to get ahead. Unfortunately, he wasn't able to study for a degree and had to work from when he was very young. to help with the household expenses. Right now, he fights day to day to offer a better future to his son and offer him the opportunities he didn't have.  

Thanks to his hard work and his wanting to get ahead, he has the economic activity of selling live pigs. He spends about 10 hours a day at this activity. His business is located in his house. The purpose of his loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business buying and selling live pigs, so that in a not too distant future, he can obtain better income. Agusto is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer low income people and poor countries such as  Nicaragua, so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his business buying and selling live pigs.

loans.name: Jisquitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JISQUITAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Remedios es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ollas de aluminio, costura de trajes, venta de chinelas, panadería, costura de chamarras polar, tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de vajillas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Remedios es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al observar, y mediante revistas, elaborando muestras pequeñas al inicio y posteriormente diseñar prendas para comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a solicitud de las clientes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, el crédito y el área de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The loan group "Jisquitas" will begin their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Panamericana. The group is comprised of 8 members and they are directed by a board of which Remedios is the treasurer. The businesses that the members run are varied: selling aluminum pots, making suits, selling slippers, running a bakery, making fleece jackets, weaving shawls, running a neighborhood store, selling tableware. 
The loan that they are requesting will benefit these micr-entreprises, including Remedios'. She tells us that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one loan cycle and she joined on the invitation of her mother who is also a member. Currently, she has a business weaving and selling shawls. She let us know that she learned this business through observation and by looking at magazines, and she began making samples and then designing pieces for market. 
The loan that she is requesting is for business capital (buying wool) from the markets in the city of El Alto and then for making and selling to her customers' orders. This manner of work enables her to generate income to maintain her home, as she lives with a partner and has a son. 
When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the savings, the loans, and the health trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Uamsho Mupya Group

texts.fr: Le client Muhima est un  brave commerçant, trésorier et membre d’un collectif  d’affaires « Uamsho Mupya », senior entrepreneur, âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants, qui sont encore gosses. Le client est un vendeur des divers articles et sociétaire d’un magasin.Il étale sa marchandise dans un magasin de la ville. Il commença ses affaires avec le fonds reçu dans le revenu d’élevage des porcs .Sa conjointe, elle aussi, est commerçante. Plus tard, il bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’il exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 50 sacs neufs d'ordinateurs. Ainsi, il souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, il remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des hommes et femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique, poste conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The borrower, Muhima, is an honest retailer who is also the member and treasurer of a business group called "Uamsho Mupya".  At age 35, he is a senior entrepreneur and the father of two children who are still quite young.  He sells various items that he displays in a shop, in his city.  He started in this business with some money made by raising pigs.  His wife is also a retailer.  Later on, he took a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima.  He has been in this business for ten years.

With this new loan, he will buy 50 new laptop bags.  Muhima would like to increase his capital, build a house, feed his children, buy them clothes and pay for their education.  In the end, he is very grateful to Hekima for empowering male and female entrepreneurs who have no access to the traditional banking system, especially during this critical moment, as the Eastern part of the country is still in a post-conflict period.

loans.use: to buy new 50 laptop bags

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a divorced woman, with one child who is still underage. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over four years, Sakina has operated a tailoring business, making garments and curtains for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, Sakina wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with five school going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mary has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors. 

She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Xiomara De Los Angeles

texts.es: Xiomara es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora de 49 años de edad, casada, su negocio es la venta de variedades ambulante desde hace 29 años, solicita crédito para  la compra de zapatos de todo estilo y ropa como pantalones, camisas, blusas de manga, blusas descotadas, shores, trajes, faldas, etc.
texts.en: Xiomara is an enterprising and fighting woman of 49 years of age. She has been selling clothing and footwear door to door for 29 years now. She is requesting a loan to buy all kinds of shoes and clothing like pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, dresses, skirts etc.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing like pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, dresses, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Valentin Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras Lidia tiene la edad de 25 años, acompañada,  se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de fritanga en su domicilio. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de tortillas, queso, plátanos verdes, plátanos maduros, carne de res, carne de cerdo, carne de pollo, tomate, chiltoma, cebolla, ajo, naranja agria, arroz, frijoles, aceite, leña, etc. Bertha tiene  28 años su negocio es la venta de fritanga, Luisa tiene 29 años su negocio es la venta de ropa.
texts.en: This group is made up of three plucky and enterprising women.  Lidia is 25 years old and has a partner.  For four years she has made a living selling "fritanga" (a local food dish) from her home.  Lidia is applying for a loan in order to buy tortillas, cheese, plantains, bananas, red meat, pork, chicken, tomato, sweet pepper, onion, garlic, bitter oranges, rice, beans, oil, firewood, and more.  Bertha is 28 years old and also sells "fritanga".  Twenty-nine-year-old Luisa has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy tortillas, cheese, plantains, bananas, red meat, pork, chicken, tomato, sweet pepper, onion, garlic, bitter oranges, rice, beans, oil, firewood, and more.

loans.name: Lourdes Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo forman tres  socios  muy trabajadores uno de ellos es Claudia mujer de 31 años, acompañada, con cuatro hijos, su negocio es la venta de gallina en el mercado municipal de Masaya desde hace 6 años se dedica a esta actividad económica. Tiene de ser cliente 3 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de gallinas por canastos, Maria mujer de 56 años su negocio es la venta de gallinas y Luis tiene 28 años su negocio es la venta de productos lácteos.
texts.en: This group is made up of three very hard-working members, one of whom is 31-year-old Claudia.  She has four children and has had a business selling hens at the town market in Masaya for six years.  She has been with the communal bank for three years. Claudia will use this loan to buy hens by the basket.  María, 56 years old, has a business selling chickens and 28-year-old Luis sells dairy products.

loans.use: to buy hens by the basket.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Belekonobougou, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiments, de savon, de l’habillement, des tubercules, de l’arachide, du poisson et des céréales.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises citées ci-dessus.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente MINATA la première personne  debout  à droite est vendeuse de poisson. Elle compte acheter un panier de poisson avec les pécheurs du village. Le poisson est vendu à Wacoro et environnants à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 9.000 FCFA qui sera en partie utilisé l’activité. 
Elle ambitionne acheter  2 chèvres pour épargne.
texts.en:
Group Danaya is made up exclusively of married women. They are on average 32 years old with four children and live in extended traditional families in Belekonobougou village in the commune of Wacoro, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali)
They met through family, friendship and neighbourhood ties. They sell condiments, soap, clothing, tubers, groundnuts, fish and cereals.
The women of the Danaya group are on their third solidarity loan. They will use the loan to purchase the various goods mentioned above.
Minata who is the first person standing on the right, is a fishmonger. She plans to buy a basket of fish from the village fishermen. She sells the fish in Wacoro and neighbouring localities to a mixed clientele. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 9.000 FCFA which she will use partly for her business.
She aims to buy two goats for her savings.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Nelson Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando Henao es un muchacho trabajador, estudioso, amoroso, responsable y soñador frente al futuro. 
Tiene un empleo el cual le encanta hacer ya que allí demuestra las capacidades para vender y entregar un buen servicio, trabaja en una aseguradora, pero aunque esa es la labor actual nunca ha dejado de tener ese amor y esa entrega por los niños, por eso escogió la carrera de Atención a la primera infancia como su profesión a ejercer, ya que al tener hijos  y al ver la necesidad que tiene este país para mejorar su educación, el desea ayudar a mejorar eso y a si poder moldear un futuro ejemplar para los suyos y para los niños en general del país.
Tiene buenas ideas para llevar a cabo, pero necesita,  como todo el mundo recursos para consolidar y efectuar los proyectos, para ello necesita el apoyo de kiva, ya que durante el primer semestre de la carrera se vio beneficiado por él convenio de kiva, espera poder contar con él para su periodo de culminación de la carrera, ya que en campo alto ha tenido buena formación académica y está seguro que a si seguirá siendo para poder alcanzar las metas. Adicional mente el tiempo en el que ha estado allí en campo alto para él ha sido excelente, ya que es el único muchacho de la clase y comparte a diario con 6 mujeres más, su maestra, al ver que él es el  único hombre de la clase  decidió tomar el puesto del monitor, brindando apoyo a las compañeras y  respetándolas tanto fuera como dentro de la institución,  al tener este lugar privilegiado debe demostrarlo, y lo hizo con las calificaciones finales del primer semestre, ya que es muy completa la formación, y demostrando así que tiene empeño y entrega por lo que hace. 
Por esa y otras razones más, solicita por favor apoyo de la en lo que le queda de formación para algún día poder devolver lo que recibe.
texts.en:
Fernando is a hardworking young man, studious, loving, responsible, and with dreams for the future.
He has a job that he loves to do as it lets him show his abilities in selling and delivering good service. He works for an insurance firm. However, although this is his current job, he has always loved working with children so he chose to pursue a career in early childhood care since he has children and he sees the need for his country to have better education and he wants to help improve this and create a good future for his kids and for the other kids in his country. 
He has good ideas for bringing this about, but he (like everyone else) needs resources to implement his projects and he needs Kiva's help for this. During his first semester of his degree he benefited from a Kiva loan and he hopes to be able to count on one for finishing his course as he has had a good educational base and is sure that he will continue to be able to reach his goals. In addition, his time at college has been good for him as he is the only guy in his class and he shares his day with 6 women. His professor, on seeing that he was the only man in the class, made him the monitor who offers support to his classmates and represents them both in the college and outside. He feels privileged to have this position and has taken it seriously, as he demonstrates with his final grades from the first semester and with his commitment and dedication to all that he does.
For this and other reasons, he is politely requesting support for what remains of his training so that, one day, he can give back what he receives.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Jessica Group

texts.es: Rosa es una de los tres socios que conforman el grupo, tiene la edad 38 años, casada, con un hijo, su negocio es la crianza de cerdo en pie para luego comercializarlos o venderlos, se dedica a esto hace 4 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de alimento para cerdos como vitaminas, purina de crecimiento, purina de engorde, salvado, otros. Fredis hombre de 43 años su negocio es la venta de madera y Telma mujer de 33 años su negocio es la crianza de cerdo en pie.
texts.en:
Rosa is one of the three members who make up this group. She is 38 years old, married and has a son. For the past four years she has been raising pigs which she later sells. The loan she is requesting is to buy animal feed like vitamins, growth and fattening blends, bran etc. 

Fredis is a 43 year old man who sells wood. Telma is 33 years old and her business is raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy animal feed like vitamins, growth blend, fattening blend, bran, etc.

loans.name: Pacto De Gracia Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres mujeres emprendedoras una de ellas es María José tiene la edad de 27 años, soltera, con tres hijos que dependen de ella, su negocio es la venta de tortillas y cosméticos desde  hace 8 años. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas como es  quintal de maíz, cal, leña, bolsas. Idalia tiene 23 años su negocio es la venta de calzado y bisutería, Xiomara tiene la edad de 49 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising women, one of whom is 27-year-old María José.  She is single and has three children who depend on her.  María's has had a business selling tortillas and cosmetics for eight years.  She needs this loan in order to buy basic supplies for making her tortillas, such as corn, lime, firewood and bags.  Idalia is 23 years old and has a business selling costume jewellery and footwear.  Xiomara is 49 years old and sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for making her tortillas, such as corn, lime, firewood and bags.

loans.name: Naim

texts.ru: Наим жизнерадостный и удивительный человек. Он родился в 1980 году. Наим женат и на воспитании имеет 2 не совершеннолетних детей. Его жена домохозяйкой и занимается воспитанием детей. Наим более 5 лет занимается бизнесом. Он занимается купле продажей детских игрушек, колыбель, велосипед и т.п. Он имеет свой собственный магазин. Наим торгует сам и сам привозит товар. Он очень честный и справедливый человек. Наим хочет увеличить свой ассортимент товара в канун Нового года. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки товара для расширения оборотного капитала. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Naim is a cheerful and extraordinary person. He was born in 1980. Naim is married and has two young children. His wife is a homemaker and is involved with brining up the children.

For more than five years, Naim has been involved in business. He buys and sells children's toys, cradles, bicycles and the like. He has his own store. Naim does the sales and procurement himself. He is a very honest and fair person.

Naim wants to expand his inventory by New Year's Eve. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy goods to expand his working capital.

loans.use: to buy cradles, toys, and other children's goods to increase his working capital for the holiday season

loans.name: Marenco Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores uno de ellos es patricia tiene la edad de 28 años, acompañada, con tres hijos, su negocio es un taller de costura en su domicilio, elaboran bordados típicos y otros desde hace 8 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 5 años. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de tela, hilos, sedas, zippers, botones, cintas de mantequilla. Henry tiene 28 años su negocio es una mini pulpería y Josefa mujer de 59 años su negocio es un taller de bordados.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members. One of them is Patricia. She is 28 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has three children. She has a sewing business in her house where she has been making traditional embroidery, etc for the past eight years. She has been a member of ADIM for five years. She needs a loan to buy cloth, thread, silk, zippers, buttons, and ribbon.

Henry is 28 and he has a small grocery store. Josefa is 59 years old and she has an embroidery workshop.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, silk, zippers, buttons and ribbon.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly is 44 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dolly has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business. Dolly has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Dolly would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is 38 years old and charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children. She started her business in 2010  to improve the family’s welfare. She has a produce store in a busy trading centre. She desires to expand her business and supply big firms like schools. Price fluctuations affect her business. She is acquiring a loan to buy more rice, beans and posho (maize flour) to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans and posho to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is  46 years old, married, and has children. She is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rosario operates a clothing business, selling men's and women’s clothes and other products. Customers are attracted to buy due to her low prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosario is requesting a loan for20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ready-to-wear products and other merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She hopes that her business will continue to flourish and that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration  God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear products

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en: Kibibi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a business woman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a widowed woman of three school-going children. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Chizi has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 32-year old married woman living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband drives a van that does not belong to him; he has to pay a daily fare to the van owner. He wants to buy his own van to drive, so that he would not have to pay the fare on a daily basis. 

Therefore, Nazia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. Nazia hopes that through this loan, her husband would be able to buy a new van, with a contribution from savings. 

Nazia belongs to a poor family; her husband is a single earning person and does not have any other source of income. 

Nazia seems very glad, and thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new van with a contribution from savings.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарине 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 несовершеннолетних детей. Самому старшему 12 лет, самому младшему 3 года. У Зарины - высшее образование, она работает преподавателем русского языка и литературы в местной школе. Зарина не только профессиональный сотрудник своего дела, но она также замечательная мама, хорошая хозяйка в доме. По характеру жизнерадостная, неунывающая, позитивная женщина. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Зарина занимается животноводством, стартовав 3 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зарины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зарина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом-на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зарина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Zarina is 36 years old, married, and with her husband is raising five young children. The oldest is 12 years old, and the youngest is 3. Zarina has a higher education. She works as a teacher of Russian language and literature in a local school. Zarina is not only a professional colleague in her job, but she is also an extraordinary mother and a good hostess in her home. By character, she is a resilient, cheerful, and positive woman.

As an additional source of income for her family, Zarina raises livestock, having begun three years ago with a livestock purchase of 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Zarina currently has on her homestead: two dairy cows, two steers, and 20 sheep. Monthly income consists of 8,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Zarina turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy cows to expand her livestock count.

Zarina plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating her livestock count, and plans to save money for her children's further education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is a married woman with four children, one of whom is in school, while the rest are adults. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over two years, Marta has operated a fruit and vegetable stall, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With this Kshs 30,000 loan, Marta wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Fawaz

texts.en: Fawaz is a 29-year-old married man with children who lives in Taiz, Yemen. Most of the money he makes is spent on raising his children and educating them. His house is very old and needs a quick renovation. The house is vulnerable to collapse at any time. He knows that such a thing needs a lot of money. He has started renovating his house but is now short of money. He needs to complete the renovation task, so he asked for a loan of 150,000 YER to buy construction supplies. He hopes that after the completion of his house renovation he will feel safe in his house with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for renovating his house

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 40-year-old woman living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Suriya’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years; it has been getting depreciated from time-to-time. He sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new rickshaw. He belongs to an ultra-poor family and has been feeding his children and meeting their needs as well. Now his children are growing old. 

Suriya has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing, some money remains short. Therefore, Suriya requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. 

Suriya hopes that now her husband will be able to make more income. Suriya is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira, a 30-year-old married mother of four, lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides banner-writing services for advertisements. His writing is very attractive because he has been writing banners for many years and thus has had great practice. He uses pieces of cheap cloths, paint and brushes to create the banners.

Humaira has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a variety of paints and cloths to continue his business. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy paint, cloths and brushes for banner writing services.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotognontala, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djekonobougou, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiments,  du beurre de karité du lait, du savon, du beignet, de céréales, des tubercules et  de la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente NAH  la personne  assise à droite est vendeuse de patate. Elle compte acheter quatre sacs de patate dans les villages environnants, qui seront vendus à Wacoro et environnants. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000 FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales
texts.en:
Group Kotognontala is made up exclusively of married women. They are on average 34 years old with three children and live in extended traditional families in Djekonobougou village in the commune of Wacoro, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali)
They met through family, friendship and neighbourhood ties. They sell condiments, shea butter, milk, soap, fritters, cereals, tubers and prepared food.
This is the first loan for the women of the Kotognontala group.
Nah, who is the person sitting on the right, sells potatoes. She plans to buy four sacks of potatoes in the neighbouring villages which she will sell in Wacoro and locally.
