She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 10.000 FCFA which she will use partly for her business, and also for family expenses.

loans.use: To buy potatoes.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат родилась в 1958 году. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Ее муж умер много лет назад от серьезной болезни. Инобат сама вырастила своих детей. Данное время ее дети совершеннолетние и помогают ей по домохозяйству. Инобат более 10 лет занимается бизнесом. Она продает сухофрукты на местном рынке. Инобат имеет большой опыт по введению бизнеса и поэтому год за годом развевает свой бизнес. Инобат от прибыли своего бизнеса провела свадебные торжества своих детей. Она хочет развевать свой бизнес и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Инобат запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Inobat was born in 1958. She is a widow and has two children. Her husband passed away many years ago from a serious illness. Inobat raised her children on her own. Today, her children are grown and they help her around the household. For more than ten years, Inobat has been involved in business. She sells dried fruits at the local market. Inobat has a lot of experience in running a business and therefore year over year she grows her business. From the profits of her business, Inobat put on wedding celebrations for her children.

She wants to develop her business and with this aim applied for a loan. Inobat is requesting a loan of 6,000 somoni to purchase dried fruits to replenish her working capital.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits to increase her working capital

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura principalmente cultivos de arroz, algodón, yucas comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y hamburguesas, desde hace 10 año, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Parque principal de Oyotun, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos sooles para invertir en su negocio compra de pollos, papas para la preparación de su producto, así como para arreglar a su carrito sandwichero y de esta manera seguir trabajando y generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia is 55 years old and lives with her husband in the Oyotún district, two hours north of the city of Chiclayo in the Labayeque region of Peru's northern coast. Here the inhabitants make a living in agriculture - growing mainly rice, cotton, yucca -, in business and in cattle raising.

Lidia has been making a living selling sausages and chips, and hamburgers for ten years. She has a stall in Oyotún's main park. Lidia has applied for a loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles to invest in her business, by buying chicken and potatoes for preparing her food to sell. She will also use the loan to repair her cart and then she will be able to continue working and earning an income for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making hamburgers and sausage and chips.

loans.name: Jeimmy Group

texts.es: Rosaura es una de los tres socios que conforman el grupo tiene la edad de 48 años, viuda, con un hijo de 11 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa y también tiene un taxi que da a trabajar tiene de vender ropa 3 años y de tener el taxi tiene 10 años, es cliente de la institución desde hace 4 años. Su hijo mayor e independiente es quien le trabaja el taxi.  El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de ropa como pantalones, camisas, blusas, shores, faldas, trajes de niños, etc. Edith mujer de 29 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa, Adolfo tiene 61 años su negocio es vender servicios fúnebres o elaboración de ataúdes.
texts.en: Rosaura is one of the group's three members.  She is 48, a widow, and has a son aged 11.  She works selling clothing and also has runs a taxi business.  She has been selling clothing for 3 years, running the taxi business for 10 years and has been one of institution's clients for 4 years.  Her elder son is no longer dependent on her and it is he who drives the taxi.  Rosaura is seeking the loan to buy clothing such as trousers, shirts, blouses, shorts, skirts, children's clothing, etc.  Edith, who is 29, sells cosmetics and clothing and Adolfo, who is 61, offers funeral services and makes coffins.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as trousers, shirts, blouses, shorts, skirts, children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: El Chilamate Ii Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres personas muy trabajadoras una de ellas es Leila mujer de 43 años, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de delantales en Managua y Granada desde hace 21 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 2 años. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales como tela de dacron, tira, hilos, perlitas, zippers, otros. Isolda tiene 23 años su negocio es la venta de delantales, Nereida mujer de 29 años su negocio es la venta de delantales.
texts.en: This group is made up of three very enterprising people, one of whom is 43-year-old Leila.  She has a partner and for 21 years she has a had a business selling aprons in Managua and Granada.  Leila has been with the communal bank for two years.  She needs this loan in order to buy supplies, such as Dacron material, bands, threads, small gems, zips, and more. Twenty-nine-year-old Nereida and 23-year-old Isolda both also have businesses selling aprons.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as Dacron material, bands, threads, small gems, zips, and more.

loans.name: Gaby Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres socios emprendedores y luchadores uno de ellos es José tiene la edad de 47 años, acompañado, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de especie desde hace. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo requiere para invertir en un nuevo negocio como es la venta de fresquitos, leche de burra, cajeta, coyolito, churrito. Cintia tiene 21 años su negocio es la venta de frutas, Francisco hombre de 40 años su negocio es la venta de especie y taxista.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising and plucky members, one of whom is 47-year-old José.  He has a partner and two children, and has a business selling spices.  He has been with the communal bank for one year.  José needs this loan in order to invest in a new business selling donkey milk, soft toffee, churros and more.  Cinita is 21 years old and has a business selling fruits. Francisco is 40 years old and has a business selling spices and also works as a taxi drivers.

loans.use: to invest in a new business selling donkey milk, soft toffee, churros and more

loans.name: Generoso

texts.en:
This is Generoso, 37, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Cristina, a vendor, and they have children. Generoso, together with his wife, manages their household while operating a business. He works hard to sustain and continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Generoso is a fish vendor. He buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. He buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer his products since they are assured of their freshness and cleanliness. His store is located in a temporary fish market. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, Generoso is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business.  

Generoso hopes that his business will continue its success and dreams that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito is 44 years old, married and has four children. He manages a farming business, which he has been doing for more than 20 years. He aims to provide a good future for his family through his business. 

Pabilito is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which he will use to buy fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides that he will use to improve his rice farmland. He knows that this amount will help him in obtaining better yields throughout the harvesting season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business to earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. 

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, Amina has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passers-by. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets to resell

loans.name: Jyldyzgul

texts.ru: Жылдызкул 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 дочек. Также вместе с Жылдызкул проживают пожилые свекр и свекровка. У Жылдызкул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жылдызкул занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом KGS. Супруг помогает Жылдызкул  в разведении скота. Семья очень дружная, дочери все школьницы, помогают по домашнему хозяйству. У Жылдызкул и ее семьи большой опыт в разведении скота. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдызкул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 3 лошади, 15 коз, 30 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдызкул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку жеребцов для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей, на следующий год старшая из дочерей Жылдызкул будет поступать в университет.
texts.en:
Jyldyzgul is 38 years old, married, and with her husband is raising four daughters. She also lives with her husband's parents. Jyldyzgul has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Jyldyzgul raises livestock, having begun 16 years ago with a livestock purchase of 12,000 som KGS. Her husband helps her in caring for the livestock. The family is very friendly. The daughters are all in school and they help with the housework.

Jyldyzgul and her family have a lot of experience caring for livestock. Thanks to her hard work, Jyldyzgul currently has on her farm: four dairy cows, three horses, 15 goats, and 30 sheep. Monthly income amounts to 9,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Jyldyzgul applied to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy stallions to expand her livestock count.

Jyldyzgul plans to invest income from the loan to further propagation of her domestic animals, and plans to save money for the further education of her children. Next year, Jyldyzgul will send her eldest daughter to college.

loans.use: to buy stallions

loans.name: Mushir

texts.en: Mushir is a 23-year-old man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a soldier who earns a small salary. He is hardworking and has tried his best to provide for his family. He has a small amount of money saved that he plans to use to open a retail shop where he will sell foods and soft drinks. He is doing this to increase his income and attract regular customers from his area. Because he does not have the necessary economic resources to invest in his business, he's decided to request a loan for 100,000 YER from AMB. With this loan he’ll buy a variety of food products and soft drinks that he will use to attract customers. In the future, Mushir hopes his family will attain better living conditions and he’ll be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy food products and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Hilda Flor

texts.es:
Hilda Flor tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el Caserío de Chiple, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio de ganado vacuno y ganadería, ubicado en la carretera Olmos – Corral Quemado, dicho caserío pertenece al distrito de Pucará, Provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas desde hace seis años, Hilda Flor se dedica a esta actividad para contribuir con los gastos familiares, es una joven emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de fruta de temporada y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda Flor is 29 years old. She lives with her parents in the village of Chiple, a rural area in the district of Pucará where the population works in agriculture and cattle and livestock trade. Chiple is located at the road from Olmos to Corral Quemado and belongs to the district of Pucará in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Hilda Flor has sold fruit for 6 years. She is doing this to help with the family expenses. She is an enterprising young woman and has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy seasonal fruit and thus offer it to her customers. By this she wants to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: El señor Elmer vive en una zona rural de la provincia de Tiraque, no cuenta con muchos recursos económicos y además tiene cinco hijos que están estudiando, vive con su esposa y trabaja en la actividad agrícola como actividad primaria y servicios de albañilería como actividad secundaria, tiene que contratar personal eventual para siembra y cosecha de sus productos que son sus vecinos, su casa está construida de adobe y  no tiene obra fina por dentro. Siempre trabajo utilizando yuntas, todavía no utiliza la tecnología agrícola solo lo tradicional. Debido a que no tiene muchos ahorros, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para comprar abono orgánico y semilla gallinaza, de esta forma seguirá trabajando y lograra aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elmer lives in a rural area of Tiraque province.  His financial resources are limited and he also has five school-age children.  He lives with his wife and has, as his main business, farming and, as his second, building services.  He has to hire temporary staff from amongst his neighbours, to sow and harvest his crops.  He lives in an adobe house which contains no fine handiwork.  He always uses teams of oxen in his work - he does not use agricultural technology yet - he just does things the traditional way.  As he does not have many savings, he has to apply for a loan to buy organic manure and poultry seed.  This will enable him to continue working and will boost his income so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and poultry seed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a  married woman who lives in Bohol, Philippines. She has run a bakery in her place for more than six years now. Her husband works as a baker. Josephine works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

Josephine is requesting a loan  to buy additional materials and ingredients for baking, such as flour, sugar, butter, and eggs. With this, they will be able to bake more bread and other snack foods to sell in their bakery, thus attracting more customers and buyers. In the future, Josephine hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and ingredients for baking, such as flour, sugar, butter, and eggs

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
Abelardo is 43 years old and has a family with two school-age children.This time, he is facing financial difficulty with his new rice production. 

With regards to his situation, he is requesting for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for the laborers who will perform some farming activities on his rice field. He is hoping that his requested loan will be approved in order to manipulate his business well. By doing this, he would be able to increase his yields for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for the laborers who will perform some farming activities to his rice field

loans.name: Jose Gavino

texts.es:
José Gavino tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío de Vista Alegre una zona rural del distrito de Pimpingos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, a seis horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de cafeto de la variedad Catimor, desde hace cuatro años, tiene sembrado 2 has, junto a su esposa se dedican también a la crianza y venta de animales menores patos, cerdos y gallinas en la parte posterior a su domicilio.

José ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos y de esta manera tener una buena producción para ofrecer a un buen precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
31-year-old José Gavino lives with his wife in the village of Vista Alegre, a rural area in the Pimpingos district.  His village depends on agriculture, trade and cattle rearing.  The community, known for its green countryside, is six hours away from the city of Cutervo, which lies in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern sierra.  
José works in agriculture and concentrates mainly on growing the Catimor variety of coffee plant.  For four years he and his wife have tended 2 hectares and have also bred and sold small animals such as ducks, pigs and hens at the rear of their home.

José has applied for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy manure for his coffee crops.  This will enable him to have a good yield so he can sell his crops at a good price and thereby generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a fish vendor from Getafe, Bohol. She sells various kinds of fresh fish to members of her local community to earn an income. Julieta works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the schooling of her children.

As of now, Julieta is asking for a loan  to buy more fresh fish to resell. With this, she will be able to sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income.

Julieta hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of her income.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana Rosa tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Zaña, dicho distrito se encuentra ubicado cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un negocio que se dedica a la venta de refrescos y chupetes, también ofrece la venta de comidas preparadas por ella misma, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos azúcar, maíz morado, piñas y diversas frutas para la preparación de sus refrescos y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes diversas opciones y al mismo tiempo generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa, who is 50 years old, lives together with her husband in the district of Zaña. This district is located nearby the valley of the Jequetepeque river, which has enabled its development via agriculture, commerce and livestock, which in one hour away from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

Juana Rosa has a business dedicated to the sale of soft drinks and lollies, she also sells food prepared by her own hands. They are a close-knit family which works hard in the work they perform.

She has sought a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to buy supplies: sugar, purple corn, pineapples and a variety of fruit to make her refreshments and in this manner offer her customers a wide choice and, at the same time, generate a larger income for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make refreshments and lollies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a farmer who lives in the highlands of Kericho with her family of six children. She has been farming for the past 15 years, producing and selling milk, eggs and tea, which are her main sources of income. Though she loves mixed farming, she says that it has a very high overhead. Grace decided to request a loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry because our organization helps low-income earners by improving their livelihoods and also has affordable interest rates on its loans. This loan will help her increase her income and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Meet Grace, a farmer living in the rich highlands of Kericho, an area known for production of the best tea. Grace is married and has three children, all of whom are of school-going age. She has been doing farming for six years, and like many farmers in the region, she produces milk and has planted some tea and vegetables on her farm. Though she enjoys farming, she faces the challenge of a lack of sufficient funds.

Grace chose Juhudi Kilimo because of the low interest rate and achievable repayment, which will increase her income, and also because they help low-income earners to improve their livelihoods. Grace will use this loan to construct a zero-grazing unit, which will give her dairy cows a good environment to produce more milk. This will increase her income base and thus help her provide a better education to her children and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: For constructing a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Gina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gina tiene 25 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con un hijo pequeño de 3 meses.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Gina trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra maiz y a la crianza de pollos para incrementar la economía de la familia. 

El cultivo que más sobresale es el maíz, los productos los vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura, compra de urea, semillas, fertilizantes y  balanceados de engorde y crianza de pollos.

El sueño es mejorar lka produccion para tener mas ingresos.

En los tiempos libres les gusta descansar y ver la television.
texts.en:
Gina is 25 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three-month-old son in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Gina is a member of the September 10th Communal Bank, which is located in Lechugalito, a neighborhood in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Gina works as a farmer, growing corn and raising chickens so that she can improve her family's finances. The crop that she grows the most is corn. Her products are sold at the market in Ventanas.

Gina is requesting a loan to use for farming. She will buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, as well as balanced feed for fattening and raising her chickens. Her dream is to improve production so that she can generate more income. In her free time, she enjoys relaxing and watching television.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, and balanced poultry feed.

loans.name: Chidodo

texts.en: Chidodo is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She is asking for a loan to purchase five more goats for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy five more goats for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married, with four children, two are in school and the others are adults. They live in their own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Fatuma's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, Fatuma wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to resell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to resell.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of six children. Her husband provides services of white wash to his customers; sometimes he has to go out of city as well. Her husband has to sit in front of a paint dealer’s shop so he can easily find a new customer, and sometimes he does not find any customers. 

Her husband got a new contract for white wash services, but he does not have paint brush or rollers to do white wash. Rubina requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy new paint brush, rollers, kerosene oil etc.

Her husband’s income is very poor. That is why her family is passing their lives in miserable conditions. She wants to change this condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her.

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools for providing white wash services.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en: Carlota has requested a $600 loan to improve her business. She is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. Her fifth child is still too young to enroll. To help support her family, she went into business in 2011 with $150 in working capital. She will use this loan to buy various items to sell in her store such as chicken, beef, eggs and buckets. She is generating a good income from her work and is thinking of expanding her business. She lives in a town with her family, and is grateful for the financial support she is receiving because it gives her the chance to improve the living conditions of her family. Her husband works as a teacher.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, eggs and buckets.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida, 29, is the mother of two children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Abida is a very hard-working and honest person.

Abida’s husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers delicious types of foods twice a day. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earns a good profit from his business. At home, Abida helps her husband by cooking various foods that her husband sells in his restaurant. He also offers tea to his customers; now he wants to expand his restaurant by purchasing new spices, utensils, a cauldron, food items, etc. Due to household expenses, his savings are not enough to buy these things.

Therefore, Abida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy spices, utensils, a cauldron, and food items. She thanks Kiva and appreciates your warm support.

loans.use: to buy spices, utensils, a cauldron, and food items for the restaurant

loans.name: Sherbet

texts.ru: Шербет 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 сыновей. Супруг занимается перевозкой грузов. Сыновья находятся на заработках в России. Работают разнорабочими, стабильной работы нет, но несмотря на это они ежемесячно высылают часть своей зарплаты родителям в Кыргызстан. У Шербет - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шербет занимается животноводством, стартовав 33 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Для содержания скота у Шербет имеются все условия, а это просторное помещение для скота, отгонные пастбища. Сено и корм в достаточном количестве уже заготовлены на зиму. Благодаря упорному труду Шербет, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 16 овец и 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шербет обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шербет планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также намерена накопить средства на ремонт дома, так как дети уже взрослые и в скором будущем они хотят отпраздновать свадебное торжество одного из сыновей.
texts.en:
Sherbet is 54 years old, married, and with her husband is raising two sons. Her husband is involved in transporting cargo. Their sons are working abroad in Russia. They work as laborers and this is not stable work, but despite that every month they send part of their salaries to their parents in Kyrgyzstan.

Sherbet has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Sherbet raises livestock, having begun 33 years ago with a livestock purchase of 5,000 som KGS. Sherbet has all the conditions to care for livestock, and there is a spacious premises and remote pastures. Hay and feed of sufficient quantity are already prepared for winter. Thanks to her hard work, Sherbet currently has on her farm: two dairy cows, 16 sheep and one horse. Monthly income amounts to 3,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Sherbet applied to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy sheep to increase her livestock count.

Sherbet plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of her quantity of domestic animals, and she also intends to save money for home repairs, since the children are already grown and in the near future they want to put on the wedding celebration for one of her sons.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is age 31; she is living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruits for many years; he sells seasonal fresh fruits in his hometown. He uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling, as a hawker. Due to his fruit’s freshness he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruits has increased and his stock runs out by noon.

Safia is taking a loan for her husband so he will be able to buy fruits in more quantity and an equilibrium scale to weigh them. Safia wants to save the excess profit so she can utilize these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es: Edwin de 31 años de edad habita en condiciones muy sencillas y humildes junto a  su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia. Edwin se gana la vida honradamente, mediante la venta de variedad de productos de primera necesidad como: huevos, papel higiénico, lejía, etc. Desea mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda por lo que ha solicitado este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones y es necesario cambiarlo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Edwin is 31 years old and lives in very simple and modest conditions with his wife and children in their own home. He makes an honest living by selling a variety of basic necessity products such as eggs, toilet paper, bleach, and other items.

Edwin wants to improve the living conditions in his home, so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI. He will invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets and wood so that he can repair the roof of his home, which is in bad condition and needs to be replaced as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets and wood for repairing the roof of his home.

loans.name: Tayiba

texts.ru: Тайиба очень добрая, отзывчивая и трудолюбивая девушка. Она на воспитании у своей тёти. Брату 23 года, сестренке 15лет. Брат Тайибы Саид учится заочно в университете, а также ездит в Россию, чтобы заработать деньги. Детство Тайибы прошло очень тяжело. Отец рано умер от болезни в печени. Начались трудные времена. Мать поехала в Россию, чтобы найти работу и прокормит маленьких детей. Оставила своих детей у тёти. Тайиба мечтала стать журналистом. Мать старалась, чтобы её дети получили хорошее образование. Несмотря на тяжелые дни, она окончила среднюю школу с отличными оценками. Вот она поступила в университет. Наконец-то сбылась мечта, но для учёбы надо платить. Дома нет сбережений. Все сбережений были потрачены на дорожные расходы Саида. Он уехал в Россию на заработки, и там работает уже 3 года. Тайиба запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Tayiba is a very kind, responsive and hardworking young woman. She was raised by her aunt. Her brother is 23 years old and her little sister is 15. Tayiba's brother Said is studying at a university in absentia, and also travels to Russia to earn money. Tayiba's childhoold was very difficult. Her father died early of liver disease and the hard times began. Her mother went to Russia to find work in order to feed her small children. She left her children with their aunt.

Tayiba dreamed of becoming a journalist. Her mother struggled so that her children would get a good education. Despite the difficult days, she finished secondary school with excellent marks. Then she enrolled in a university. Finally a dream had come true, but one must pay for schooling. The household has no savings. All the savings were spent on Said's travel expenses. He left for Russia for work and has been working there for three years.

Tayiba is requesting a loan to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay for her education

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en Laynas una zona rural del distrito de la Matanza, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad tranquila, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al comercio de animales menores patos, gallinas y cerdos desde hace tres años, con la ayuda de su esposa también lo realizan en el mercado de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
35-year-old Alfredo lives with his wife and children in Laynas, a rural area in the Matanza district.  The community, which depends on farming, trade and cattle rearing, lies in Morropon province in the Piura region of Peru's north coast.
Aided by his wife, he has been rearing and selling small animals (ducks, hens and pigs) for three years and they also sell their animals in the local market.  Alfredo has applied for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy formulated feed to fatten his animals.  This will enable him to have more to offer to his customers and to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy formulated feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Sorpresa Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios trabajadores uno de ellos es Louis tiene la edad de 23 años, soltera, dependen de ella dos personas, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 10 años, lleva de ser cliente de la institución 4 años, su mama le ayuda a atender el negocio. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, papel higiénico, gaseosas, cigarros, meneítos, otros. Xóchitl tiene 39 años su negocio es una pulpería y Carlos tiene 48 años se dedica al negocio de la venta del derivado de maíz.
texts.en:
This group consists of three hardworking members. One of them is Louis. She is 23 years old, single, and has two dependents. Her business is a grocery store that is located in her home. She has managed this business for 10 years and has been a client of ADIM for four years. Her mother helps her with managing the business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, toilet paper, sodas, cigarettes, snack foods, and other items.

Xóchitl is 39 years old and also has a grocery store. Carlos is 48 years old and has a business selling products made from corn.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, toilet paper, sodas, cigarettes, snack foods, and other items.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira is 37 years old, married, and has four children. As a child, she helped her parents with animal husbandry. Now, she has her own large family and needs to earn money. Her husband is a migrant. 

Zamira is going to organize a new business of animal husbandry. She took part in a course, "To Get Ahead" with a women's organization, wrote her business plan, and received a certificate. She is requesting a loan for 2,000 somoni, which she will use to buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 34 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Он последнее время не отправляет достаточно денег жене, чтобы она могла покрыть все расходы семьи. Гулчехра хочет организовать свой бизнес и найти свой источника дохода. Она планирует организовать бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов как изюм, орех, миндаль и т.п. Она будет торговать на местном рынке. Гулчехра составила свой бизнес план, и она уверена, что ее бизнес будет процветать, так как спрос на сухофрукты, больше на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a cheerful woman. She is 34 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband is working migrant in the Russian Federation. Lately, he has not been sending enough money to his wife in order for her to be able to cover all the family's expenses.

Gulchehra wants to establish her own business and to find her own income source. She plans to start a business buying and selling dried fruits such as raisins, nuts, almonds and the like. She will trade at the local market. Gulchehra created her business plan and is confident that her busines will flourish, since demand for dried fruits is huge at the local market.

She is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy dried fruits, in order to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for organizing a new business

loans.name: Luis Diomenes

texts.es:
Luis Diomenes tiene 41años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hija en el distrito de Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por un clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de arroz, frutas y café, comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, transportando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, también se desempeña como operario de una máquina cosechadora, cuenta con más de 4 años de experiencia, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Diomenes, 41, lives with his wife and daughter in the district of Pucará, it is a community which is characterized by a hot climate, its people make their living in farming, in particular growing rice, fruit and coffee, as well as selling these goods and in livestock. The area is located at two hours after from the city of Jaén, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, a sierra in the north of Peru.

Luis Diomenes makes his living in public transport with his own motorcycle taxi, carrying passengers to the country houses nearby his district. He also works as a combine harvester operative, with more than four years of experience. He has sought a loan for 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles for the upkeep of his vehicle and in this way continue earning more money for his family.

loans.use: to upkeep his vehicle.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad cercana al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, su población también se dedica al comercio y ganadería, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral patos, gallinas y cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, junto a su esposo tienen una panadería donde elaboran mediante un horno artesanal diversos tipos de panes.

Agustina ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de sacos de harina, azúcar entre otros insumos para panadería y de esta manera tener mayores productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le generará mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina is 43 years old, she lives together with her family in the district of Zaña, a community nearby the valley of the Jequetepeque river, which has allowed it to develop through farming, its inhabitants also make their living in commerce and livestock, Zaña is one hour away from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru.

Agustina makes her living rearing and selling farmyard animals: ducks, chicken and guinea pigs. Her business is located in the back end of her home. Together with her husband, they own a bakery when they make all types of bread in a traditional oven.

Agustina has sought a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to buy bags of flour, sugar and so on for the bakery and in this manner have more products to offer her customers which would generate a larger profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make bread.

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
Novie is thankful for the financial assistance she has received. She used it to buy more products to sell in her store, pay her bills and cover the cost of educating of her children. She is applying for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better, because this means higher profits, which she will use to sustain her family’s daily needs and pay children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Novie dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy various items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Chispa Adecuada Group

texts.es: Cuatro son las integrantes del grupo una de ellas es Osmara tiene 24 años, soltera, su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 11 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de sandalias bajas, altas, sandalias de niñas. Olga tiene 45 años su negocio es la venta de zapatos, Verónica tiene 24 años su negocio es la venta de plátanos, Yessica tiene 20 años su negocio es la venta de zapatos.
texts.en:
Four members make up this group. One of them is Osmara. She is 24 years old, single, and has been in the business of selling clothes and shoes for 11 years. Osmara has been a client of ADIM for one year. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy flat sandals, open-toe high heels, and girls' sandals.

Olga is 45 years old and has business of selling shoes. Verónica is 24 years old and has a business of selling bananas. Yessica is 20 years old and has a business of selling shoes.

loans.use: to buy flat sandals, open-toe high heels, and girls' sandals.

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Жылдызкан - средне-специальное образование, она работает воспитателем в детском саду. Жылдызкан очень любит детей, поэтому и своих детей у нее 4- 3 сына и 1 дочь. Супруг занимается хозяйством, определенной работы нет. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Жылдызкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 11 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдызкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдызкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Jyldyzkan is 41 years old, married, and with her husband is raising four children. Jyldyzkan has a specialized secondary education. She works as an educator in a kindergarten. Jyldyzkan likes children very much, and of course her own children: three sons and a daughter. Her husband is engaged in farming, not a specific job. As an additional source of income for her family, Jyldyzkan raises livestock, having begun 11 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Jyldyzkan currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow, one steer, and 10 sheep. Monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Jyldyzkan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy cows to increase her livestock count.

Jyldyzkan plans to invest income from the loan to further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Belgica Conzuelo

texts.es:
Belgica tiene 60 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con dos hijos que aun son solteros pero en total tiene seis hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Belgina trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra maiz, arroz, cacao y a la crianza de pollos y cerdos para incrementar la economía de la familia. 

El cultivo que más sobresale es el maíz, los productos los vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura, compra de urea, semillas, fertilizantes y una bomba para utilizar los insecticidas y  balanceados de engorde y crianza de pollos y cerdos

El sueño es mejorar lka produccion para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Belgica is 60 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and with two children who are still single, but in total she has six children. She lives in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios.

She is a member of the solidarity group "10th of September," which is located in Lechugalito, a precinct that belongs to the Ventanas canton and the province of Los Rios.

Belgica works in agriculture. She plants corn, rice, and cacao and raises chickens and pigs to augment the family economy.

The crop that is most important is corn. She sells her products in the market in Ventanas.

She is applying for the loan for her farming work. She will buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, and a pump to use for insecticides, as well as balanced feed to fatten and raise chickens and pigs.

Her dream is to improve her production in order to have more income.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, and a pump to use for insecticides.

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 46-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

Her husband is a turner by profession. He works with a lathe machine; he manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars, and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles and  renews the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and until this time his business has been very settled. 

Due to continuously working on the lathe machine,  some important parts have torn off which urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of the affected parts,  it highly affects the whole mechanism of  the lathe machine.

Her husband is a poor person; he does not have a sufficient amount of money to buy spare parts to fix the problems of the lathe machine. Also he could buy cutting tools. 

Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband so he can buy spare parts for his lathe machine. Shehnaz hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for a lathe machine, tools, and cutting tools to work with the lathe machine.

loans.name: Buen Progreso Group

texts.es: Blanca es una de las tres socias del grupo tiene 38 años de edad, soltera, con cinco hijos, su negocio  es la compra y venta de cosechas en el mercado de Masaya desde hace  9 años, tiene a tres personas que le ayudan a en el proceso de corte. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 3 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosechas de tamarindo. Olga tiene la edad de 60 años su negocio es el destace de cerdo en pie, Miriam tiene 53 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Blanca, a member of the trio pictured above, is 38 years old and is a single mother of five children. For the past 9 years, she has worked selling fresh produce in the market in Masaya, and she has three people who help her with the logistics of getting her produce to market. 

With the support from this loan, Blanca plans to purchase tamarind fruit for resale at her business. She has been a member of the community bank for three years. Olga, another group member who is 60 years old, works as a pig butcher. Miriam, 53 years old, is the final member of the trio and makes a living selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase tamarind fruit for her business.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Soutoura est un regroupement de femmes de Sogomougou qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les tissus, Soumbala, Savon, Légume, Condiments, Poisson, Couture et autres. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe. 
Fatim est un membre du groupe Soutoura assise dans le rang de devant et en 2 eme position de la droite vers la gauche.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chargements de charrettes en bananes yoyo, en légumes et d’autres fruits au fur et à mesure elle vend.  Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala en grande quantité et les vend en détail au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Soutoura comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 144 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Fatim compte réaliser  160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Soutoura is a group of women from Sogomougou who know each other well and who live in big traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are 33 years old on average, married, and have at least three children. 

This group of women sell items such as cloth, soumbala (a local condiment), soap, vegetables, condiments, fish, and do sewing, etc. In order to grow their businesses, the members decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their seventh group loan.

 Fatim is a member of Soutoura group and is sitting in the first row, second person right to left. She intends to use her loan to buy wagonloads of yoyo bananas, vegetables and other fruits according to her sales. She buys her goods in Koutiala in bulk and sells them retail and for cash out of her home and at the market to a diverse clientele. 

Whereas the other members of the Soutoura group expect to make an average profit of 144,000 F CFA each during this loan period, Mme Fatim hopes to make 160,000 F CFA. Besides reimbursing the loan, the group members will use part of the income to cover personal expenses and grow their working capital.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Yiriwa est un regroupement de  femmes de Koutiala quartier Hamdallaye qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, sont mariées et au ont moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes de Koutiala fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, de condiments, Jus,  Sucre, Soumbala et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur douzième prêt de groupe. 
Haby 1ère assise de la droite vers la gauche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de Soumbala. Elle se procure de ces Soumbala  à Koutiala et les vend au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Yiriwa comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 180 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Haby compte réaliser  220 000FCFA.   
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter leur fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Yiriwa is a group of women from the Hamdallaye neighbourhood of Koutiala.  They live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and extended families.  They are all around thirty-three years old, married and have an average of two children.  The women of the group buy and sell various items, such as food ingredients, juice, sugar, soumbala (ground, cooked seeds or beans), etc.

In order to increase the size of their businesses, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their twelfth group loan.

Haby (sitting on the right of the picture) will use her loan to buy soumbala.  She buys her supplies of soumbala in Koutiala, and sells them for cash, from her home and at the market, to a diverse clientele.

The other members of the group expect to earn a monthly average of 180,000 francs CFA, but Haby expects to earn 220,000 francs CFA.

The women will use their earnings to repay their loans, provide for the expenses of their families and increase their working capital.

loans.use: to buy soumbala for resale.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
Zaynura, 25, is a hard-working married woman and has four children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Zaynura does not have a higher education, but has always wanted to get a degree.

She has some land where she grows crops, but her income from growing crops is small. She is going to organize a new business in animal husbandry. With this aim, she completed and earned her certificate in the ‘To Get Ahead’ program at a women’s organization.

Zaynura is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Husniya

texts.ru: Хусния очень трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности, и имеет достаточный опыт по животноводству и выращивания сельхоз культур. Детство Хуснии прошла очень тяжело. Ее отец был больным, а мама не имела постоянной место работы. Самых ранних лет она  работала на поле. После окончания школы она поступила в Медицинский колледж. Повзрослев, она вышла замуж. Данное время она имеет 3 детей. Ее муж занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Хусния тоже хотела организовать свой бизнес и найти источника дохода. Шесть месяцев назад она начала свой бизнес животноводством. Хусния запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота для расширения оборотного капитала нового бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Husniya is a very hardworking and determined woman. She was born in the countryside, and has sufficient experience raising livestock and growing crops. Husniya's childhood was very challenging. Her father was ill, and her mother did not have enough work.

From her earliest years, she worked in the fields. After high school, she enrolled in the College of Medicine. Growing up, she got married. Currently, she has three children. Her husband grows crops. Husniya also wanted to start her own business and find a source of income. Six months ago, she started her business raising livestock.

Husniya is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy livestock to expand the working capital of a new business.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her new business

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DJIGUISSEME est constitué de  4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3ème prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de   produits de beauté à l’image de KADIATOU qui est la femme assise   dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, diversses quantités de pommades  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme Group is made up of four married women, around the age of thirty-five, they each have four children.  They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Nord region of the town of Bougouni.  The women know one another through friendship, business and neighbourhood ties.

In order to improve their financial status and become more efficient with their businesses, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their third loan with the field partner.  The previous two loans have been fully and correctly repaid.

The women buy and sell beauty products.  Kadiatou (sitting in the photo) will use her loan to buy skin cream from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She sells her products from her home and at the market, on a cash or credit basis, to a wide range of customers.

Kadiatou expects to earn a monthly average of 20,000 francs CFA, and she will use her earnings to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy skin cream for resale.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Ella es Alejandra, desde pequeña el sueño es ser artista, a pesar de no tener los medios necesarios quiere cumplir con el sueño, ella ha tenido que vivir junto con la familia en diferentes pueblos y muy humildemente, ya que en tiempo pasado no tenían los medios para pagar un arriendo, aun así sobrevivieron y ahora viven mejor, ella nunca cambio la mentalidad de ser una gran artista superando cualquier dificultad, la vida para ella es una difícil tarea que esta dispuesta a asumir con la fuerza que nace del  alma y con las ganas de ser ejemplo para los hermanos menores que emprenden esta vida y cumplen con los más grandes anhelos.  
Gracias al apoyo que ha recibido por parte de Kiva, ha logrado terminar el segundo semestre en el cual aprendió técnicas y evoluciono la manera de dibujar, ha logrado también obtener las pinturas y papeles que se requieren en esta carrera, aportando a los dotes un concepto de publicidad el cual ha mejorado también con el vocabulario y el desarrollo de ideas, el cual a futuro le ayudara a obtener mejores oportunidades de manera laboral, de igual manera también ha logrado mantenerse al día y así lograr seguir adquiriendo los conocimientos de los profesores y compañeros, hoy se va  formando tanto profesional como humanamente, y agradece la colaboración al igual que espera terminar los estudios con méritos y cumplir el sueño de ser una artista. Va por buen camino y con anhelos de seguir adquiriendo nuevos métodos y conocimiento. 
Cuando la gran preocupación de continuar en los estudios estaba en no obtener la economía suficiente para obtener lo de los materiales, gracias a KIVA siente el alivio de preocuparse por ser la mejor académica mente y la mayor alegría es saber que existen entidades las cuales ayudan a cumplir los sueños de las personas que difícilmente pueden seguir con los estudios solos.
Gracias por la atención y colaboración dirigida.
texts.en:
This is Alejandra whose dream from a young age is to be an artist. Despite not having the means to do so, she wants to make her dream a reality. She has had to live with her family in different towns and in a very humble manner, as in the past they didn't have the funds to pay the rent. Even so, they survived and now they live better. Alejandra never changed her mind about becoming a great artist and overcoming any difficulty whatsoever. For her, life is a difficult undertaking that she is ready to take on with the force born from her spirit and the desire to be an example for her younger siblings who are setting out in this life and want to achieve their greatest desires.

Thanks to the support that she has received from Kiva, she has managed to finish her second semester in which she learnt techniques and improved in her manner of drawing. She was also able to obtain the paint and paper that are needed for this course, adding a concept of advertising to her skills which has also helped with the vocabulary and development of ideas that, in the future, will help her obtain better work opportunities. Similarly, she has also managed to keep up-to-date and therein continue gaining knowledge from the professors and fellow classmates, today, she is developing on both a professional and a personal level and she is grateful for the contributions. Likewise, she hopes to finish her studies with good grades and realize her dream of becoming an artist. She is on the right track and dreams of continuing to acquire new methods and skills. 

When her greatest worry about continuing her studies was not having enough money to obtain the course materials, it was thanks to Kiva that she felt the weight lifted off her so that she could concentrate on being the best academically speaking and it is a real joy to know that there are organizations which help make the dreams of those people who would have difficulty in continuing to study alone a reality.

Many thanks for your attention and collaboration.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of schooling.

loans.name: Aisalkyn

texts.ru: Айсалкын 51 год, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывают 4 детей. У Айсалкын - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айсалкын занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айсалкын, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсалкын обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Айсалкын планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Aisalkyn is 51 years old, married, and with her husband is raising four children. Aisalkyn has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Aisalkyn raises livestock, having begun 18 years ago with a livestock purchase of 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Aisalkyn currently has on her homestead: four dairy cows, two horses, and 15 sheep. Monthly income amounts to 11,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Aisalkyn turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy steers for fattening and subsequent sale in the market at a premium.

Aisalkyn plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Erika Noemi

texts.es:
Erika Noemí tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en Morropon, una comunidad que guarda mucha tradición, también se le conoce como la capital del Tondero, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, venta de cerveza y bebidas, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio desde hace dos años por lo que cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
30-year-old Erika Noemi lives with her husband and children in Morropon, in the Piura region on Peru's north coast.  The community upholds many of its traditions and is also known as the capital of the Tondero dance.  The inhabitants work in agriculture, trade and cattle rearing.
Erika has sold groceries, beer and soft drinks for two years.  Having hershop in her own home means that she has a steady clientele.  She has applied for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to stock her shop and thereby generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to stock her shop.

loans.name: Segunda Lucero

texts.es:
Segunda Lucero tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, frutales y arroz, comercio de los mismos y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio y crianza de animales menores gallinas y patos, las compras lo realiza en los caseríos aledaños para posteriormente ofrecerlos en los restaurants de la zona, su esposo se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su propia mototaxi, así como a construcción civil.

Segunda Lucera ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
33-year-old Segunda Lucero lives with her husband and children in Pucará district.  The community is known for its warm climate and lies 2 hours away from the city of Jaén, which is in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern sierra.  The inhabitants work in agriculture, growing coffee, fruit and rice in particular.
Segunda breeds and sells small animals such as hens and ducks.  She buys them in neighbouring villages and later offers them for sale to local restaurants.  Her husband runs a transport service in his own motortaxi, as well as doing some building work.

Segunda Lucero has applied for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy small animals which she will then fatten up and sell to her customers.  This will enable her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various bales of clothing.

loans.name: Grupo Triunfador Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Grupo Triunfador, está conformada por once integrantes, madres solteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadores, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Rosalpina y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergentes, huevos, crema, hielo, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Grupo Triunfador” (Triumphant Group) communal bank has eleven members; single mothers with 20 children under their care. They are originally from Sauce, located in the northern area of the country. They are known for being responsible, hard working and with a strong drive towards personal development.  Unfortunately, because of lack of economic resources they couldn’t go to school. They felt obligated from a very young age to help with household expenses.

Thanks to their efforts and desire to come out ahead, the coordinator is Rosalpina. She has a ‘pulpería’, a small store that sells food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, cream, ice, juices, fizzy drinks... She spends 12 hours daily at her business selling her products. Her business is located in her house. The aim for the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in the buying and selling of food products, so that in the near future she can gain a better income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her convenient store with food products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergents, eggs, cream, ice, juices, fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Shodikul

texts.ru: Шодикул родился в сельской местности. С раннего детства Шодикул помогал отцу по выращиванию сельхоз культур и скотоводству. Шодикул единственный сын в семье. Он женат и имеет одного сына. Шодикул обратился в нашу организацию во второй раз за займом в размере 2000 сомони. По словам Шодикула за полученный  займ, он собирается использовать на покупку корма для скота, т. к. Шодикул пасёт крупный рогатый скот-быка, который будет готов к продаже через месяц. Шодикул говорит, что сейчас продажа быка не имеет пользы. Введению бизнеса ему помогают его отец, мать и жена. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shodikul was born in the countryside. From early childhood, Shodikul helped his father in growing crops and shepherding. Shodikul is the only son in the family. He is married and has one son.

Shodikul turned to IMON for the second time, for a loan of 2,000 somoni. In Shodikul's words, he intends to use the loan received to buy feed for cattle, and the like. Shodikul tends to bulls, which will be ready for sale in a month. Shodikul says that that selling a bull now is of no avail. In running the the business, he is helped by his father, mother, and wife.

loans.use: to buy feed for cattle

loans.name: Los Geranios De Mollepata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GERANIOS DE MOLLEPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Mollepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Mercedes  ella es casada, tiene 59 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de restaurante turístico, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de platos como sopas,arroz con pollo ,saltados, platos a la carta entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir  apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como arroz,aceite entre otros para su negocio.

La socia que salen en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de celulares, agricultura, tienda de abarrotes, restaurante, tienda escolar, turismo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "THE GERANIUMS OF MOLLEPATA". This bank is located in the district of Mollepata, which belongs to the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

Mercedes, one of the members, is 59 years old, married and has two children. She combines her daily activities with her tourist restaurant business. She has been carrying out this business for quite some time and it is going well thanks to her constant effort. This member sells different types of dishes such as soups, chicken and rice, saltados [typical Peruvian dishes] and other dishes her customers ask for. This member hopes to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

Mercedes is requesting a loan in order to buy food supplies such as rice, and oil, among other items, for her business.

The member who appears added into the photo asked for permission to arrive late due to work commitments.

The other members make a living selling mobile phones, farming, running a grocery store, restaurant, school shop and in tourism.

This member is grateful to those who form part of making her dream come true through this loan and she is committed to paying her loan payments promptly.

loans.use: to buy food supplies such as rice and oil, among other things.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan vive en la ciudad de Chincha y trabaja como docente en un centro educativo de su ciudad, lleva laborando desde hace 6 años y el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene mucha paciencia para enseñar.

Juan gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder mejorar las paredes de la vivienda donde habita, asimismo colocara un piso de cemento, entre otros, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the city of Chincha and works as a teacher at an education center there. With six years teaching experience, he believes things are going well professionally because he has lots of patience in the classroom with his students.

With the support from this loan, Juan plans to purchase construction materials to reinforce the walls of his home, as well as put in a cement floor and make other improvements to his living space. He is grateful for this opportunity to improve his quality of life and continue working towards his dream of having his own business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Maredsa

texts.en:
Maredsa, a 37-year-old married mother of four, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for five years, and earns additional income from food vending. 

Having received and repaid one previous loan from NWTF, Maredsa has requested a new one for PHP 5000 to purchase additional goods such as coffee, milk, cereals, cooking oil, sanitary napkins, canned goods, etc. to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as coffee, milk, cereals, cooking oil, sanitary napkins, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Marta de 46 años , es la propietaria de un taller de costuras que inició hace 10 años, cuando capitalizó la experiencia en confecciones, que traía desde niña, apoyada por una amiga suya, quien la contactó con un almacén de ropa infantil, del cual generó ahorros, los cuales invirtió en su negocio.  En la actualidad sus principales productos, son la ropa para niños y niñas, los cuales elabora en su taller, mediante las operaciones de diseño, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas y vende a crédito, comprando las materias primas de contado, en grandes proveedores de telas y especializados, en insumos para la confección. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su taller, mejorando cualitativamente los acabados de la producción y con ello vender más, ganar más y aumentar su calidad de vida. Esta es la razón, por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  una máquina fileteadora, e insumos para confección, como telas, hilos y accesorios, para complementar un acabado a la medida de las fiestas navideñas, que se acercan y que impulsan sus ventas y mas aun, teniendo una oferta de mayor calidad, con esta inversión.
texts.en:
Marta is 46 years old and has been the owner of a sewing shop she started 10 years ago, when she leveraged the experience she had in making clothing, from when she was a child.  She got help from a friend with a children’s clothing store who contacted her.  This generated income that she invested into her business.  Currently her main products are boys’ and girls’ clothing, which she designs, prepares, makes, and finishes in her shop and sells on credit.  She buys her supplies in cash from large fabric suppliers who specialize in clothes making supplies.  Her future goals are to expand her workshop, improve her items, and increase her sales to generate more income and improve her quality of life.

This is the reason that she requested a Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
